org.daisy.streamline.api.config

Class UserConfigurationsCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.daisy.streamline.api.config.UserConfigurationsCollection

  • public final class UserConfigurationsCollection
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides a user configuration collection that lets a user add and remove configurations at runtime. This class is not intended for direct use. The intended use is as part of a UserConfigurationsProvider implementation. By implementing the UserConfigurationsProvider, the configurations will be available through the ConfigurationsCatalogService API.

    This class has all the methods of the UserConfigurationsProvider interface but doesn't implements it. This is intentional. For example, this class lacks a constructor without arguments, which is required for service discovery using both SPI and OSGi. This class has also been made final to prohibit a UserConfigurationsProvider implementation from extending it.

    Note: this class is not connected directly to the ConfigurationsCatalog because of restrictions imposed by the API design guidelines. To solve the problem, the ExclusiveAccess interface was created (an implementation of this interface would have been too general to be a public part of this API but to useful to keep private).

        Adds a configuration to this catalog.
        Parameters:
        niceName - the display name

        config - the configuration details
